item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 2, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Britain's postwar sugar craze confirms harms of sweet diets in early life (72 points | 12 comments)
2. Show HN: A minimalist (brutalist?) website for sharing all your links (30 points | 15 comments)
3. Show HN: Someday, Open-Source Calendly Alternative for Gmail / Google App Script (55 points | 15 comments)
4. Weird Lexical Syntax (247 points | 100 comments)
5. Show HN: SpawELO - small free matchmaking system for LAN parties (20 points | 1 comment)
6. The motor turns (too much) (4 points | discuss)
7. Cramming Solitaire onto a Nintendo E-Reader card (109 points | 25 comments)
8. Apple acquires Pixelmator (1136 points | 536 comments)
9. Xpanceo smart contact lenses hands-on (26 points | 6 comments)
10. Cash: An absurdly small jQuery alternative for modern browsers (58 points | 36 comments)
11. Hacking the T2S+ Out of Fear: Get Lock-In Thermography for Free (139 points | 10 comments)
12. Ghosts in the Machine (39 points | 22 comments)

18. Make It Yourself (555 points | 72 comments)
19. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (November 2024) (348 points | 316 comments)
20. Alexander the Great's tunic identified in royal tomb at Vergina? (310 points | 157 comments)
21. Direct Sockets API in Chrome 131 (159 points | 124 comments)
22. My Time Working at Stripe (312 points | 273 comments)
23. Tabular (YC S24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
24. Letters by Oliver Sacks review (53 points | 9 comments)
25. Breaking the image: a 12th-century AI Weiwei? (15 points | 9 comments)
26. The almost-lost art of rosin potatoes (112 points | 121 comments)
27. TokenFormer: Rethinking Transformer Scaling with Tokenized Model Parameters (170 points | 28 comments)
28. Starlink satellite phone will have coverage where no other will go (9 points | discuss)
29. If You Think You Can Hold a Grudge, Consider the Crow (17 points | 8 comments)
30. The 1600s were a watershed for swear words (2022) (99 points | 108 comments)
